author: Staff Reporter
text:
To be trained:Sunny, a three-month-old Doberman, that has joined the sniffer dog squad.— Photo: C. Venkatachalapathy

More than five months after sniffer dog Cheetah succumbed to cancer, the Vellore police’s dog squad has got a new member – a three-month-old male Doberman.

The puppy will undergo training at the police’s training centre in Coimbatore. It has replaced Cheetah, a female German Shepherd, which had assisted police personnel in nearly 150 crime cases for nearly seven years.

The new member has been named ‘Sunny’ by P. Pakalavan, Superintendent of Police, Vellore.

With Sunny, the number of members in the sniffer dog squad has now risen to four – two for crime and two for explosives detection. While eight-year-old Tiger and five-year-old Lucy are engaged in explosives detection, four-year-old Simba assists in crime, he added. All three were Labradors.

“After a training of six months, Sunny assist in crime cases,” he added.
title: Dog squad in Vellore gets a new member
